intro: Stenostephanus pilosus, commonly known as the hairy stephanus, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features hairy stems and leaves, which help it retain moisture in its arid native habitat. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with a distinctive central disk surrounded by ray florets. Stenostephanus pilosus is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to withstand periods of drought.
